newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: HK's Tsang sees solid five pct trend growth.
newsitem.headline: HK's Tsang sees solid five pct trend growth.

text.p: Hong Kong Financial Secretary Donald Tsang said on Thursday he saw economic growth at a rate of around five percent, with some fluctuations.
"Our trend growth rate of five percent in real terms is pretty solid," Tsang told a news conference in Wellington.
"There will be fluctuations in individual years, but it won't be a big margin," Tsang said.
He said inflation was under control and the Hong Kong dollar was "rock solid".
Tsang said he would be making a scheduled announcement "the day after tomorrow" on latest growth projections.
